channel.title: Webclient problem
channel.description: I'm trying to get an webclient to work. I'm using RSCAngel's source. It loads the client smoothly, but wont let me login. It says "Unable to connect", I guess that theres wrong server ip in the .jar file. When I try to decompile the .class file where the server ip is set, it doesnt decompile it right.

item.title: Webclient problem
item.dc:creator: @iPhone4 iPhone4
item.description:
@iPhone4 wrote:

I wouldn’t worry about using that rscd_v25 webclient. Its very glitchy and will crash the browser frequently. Go with a hash checker that downloads the cache as a single zip file and then executes the client jar from the cache folder. That approach for me has been the best. The client does not have to be a part of the browser to still work on any OS.

If you would like to try out what I have used:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Vicd, you once posted about a RSCD clan system and that you were able to get it working. Would you mind sharing it if you still have it? I am looking at constructing one for DarkQuest.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient problem
item.dc:creator: @Vicd Vicd
item.description:
@Vicd wrote:

[quote=“Anc13ntsIsBack, post:4, topic:396236”]So you’re trying to decompile someones webclient?
Wait, A.class,b.class? You’re trying to decompile RscEmulations webclient. lol.[/quote]hmmm…
Well I got it from the RSCAngel files, and the .jar was named rsca.jar
Uh oh, I thought it was easier to make it work, but I guess not.
Back to studying more java --> ;D

Edit: so I got the .class file open where the server ip is set, and it was “f2p.rscangel.org” so I don’t think it’s emulation’s webclient :rolleyes:

Edit2: So I found the Open Source Webclient for RSCDV25, I followed the instructions, but the client won’t load, it says:

When I check the .jar, the mudclient.class is there.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Vicd wrote:

uberpk3r:

de-compile ? != oh good; and utl/config class i believe .

Yea I know that its the config.class normally, but I in the .jar which was in the same .rar package with the web_app_easy.html the .class files are named like a.class b.class c.class etc

When I try to open one of them with Eclipse I get this error:
